title: Three suggestions how to improve lost SSH connection
author: igor2x
body_snippet:
I have been using mRemoteNG for years. Currently I am using mRemoteNG officially stable version 1.76.20 on Windows 10.

1. Open some SSH connection to e.g. Linux computer.
2. Reboot remote computer: "sudo reboot" type in password and press Enter. Problem appears. Dialog is displayed "Remote side unexpectedly closed network connection".
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10895030/227530307-3bf5acb6-b8e5-4855-adab-1be44cce0e79.png)


This is not the best user experience beca...

comments.snippet:
5. Additional suggestion. When connection is closed down in most cases I want to reestablish connection. Some kind of dialog would be nice to offer connection retry option. But I probably don't want to have real dialog, because in case I want to close the tab I would need to click on Cancel on dialog, which is additional click I don't want to.

May I suggest every time connection is lost at tab where connection is lost. Notifications tab should auto appear with bellow text.
![image](https://u...
comments.author: igor2x

comments.snippet:
We retry on RDP connections so a retry with SSH seems doable.

note: Changing putty dialogs would require making changes to the puttyng project which is written in C.
comments.author: BlueBlock

comments.snippet:
> We retry on RDP connections so a retry with SSH seems doable.

The difference is that with RDP the session is retained, while with SSH all output is lost when reconnecting (with putty). Therefore one need to be careful when implementing an auto-reconnect...
comments.author: simonai1254

comments.snippet: @simonai1254, thanks for update on SSH reconnecting. I am not suggesting to create automatic reconnect when connection is established and working well. My suggestion above is just when SSH connection is lost, to make it possible to automatically reconnect. In most cases this happens when remove machine was rebooted.
comments.author: igor2x

comments.snippet:
Is the use of putty for ssh really important to everyone? Or can another ssh implementation be added which more easily supports reconnection, among other things?

Does WinSSHTerm have any code on github?
comments.author: BlueBlock

comments.snippet: In my personal view I do not care how SSH is implemented in mRemoteNG, as long as it's user friendly and covers for everyone's need (tunneling, certificates etc.). There are ideas to use SSH.net (see #181), the only important thing for me is to keep it streamlined and continue to just integrate one solution and that one well.
comments.author: simonai1254

comments.snippet: puttyng exist not just because ;) mR depends on its work, however happy if we manage to have another implementation however keep in mind it should be secure and dont left passwords in memory in plain text.
